p: The mean, median, and range of diameters of beetle-killed and survivor P. albicaulis were similar ( Table 2 ). The mean diameter was not significantly different between survivor and beetle-killed trees, while the diameter of general population trees, as expected, differed significantly from both groups ( Table 2 ). The same was true for P. contorta ( Table 2 ). Similarly, mean diameters of MPB-killed and survivor P. albicaulis and P. contorta did not differ from one another. However, the minimum size of tree attacked by the beetle differed by tree species resulting in the choice of different diameter distributions for sampling general population trees ( Table 2 ). Blister rust infection severity was overall very low at the site, but significantly lower in survivors (mean = 1.3, SD = 1.8) than in general population trees (mean = 1.7, SD = 2.4; F = 1.63, df = 65, P = 0.013; potential range 0â€“18).
